intro: Draba pachythyrsa, commonly known as the thick-ribbed whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Draba pachythyrsa has a compact growth habit with basal leaves and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
